intro: Chailletia paniculata, commonly known as the panicled chailletia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange inflorescences that consist of numerous small florets arranged in a panicle shape. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Chailletia paniculata is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
